meanings.definition: A place where young children are cared for during the day.
meanings.sent1: The local community center offers affordable creches for working parents.
meanings.sent2: Many families rely on creches for childcare while they are at work.
meanings.sent3: The toddlers at the creches always seem to have more energy than the staff!
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, creches are like havens of laughter and play.
meanings.sent5: The colorful walls of the creches echo with the laughter of children.

meanings.definition: A representation of the Nativity scene with figurines of Mary, Joseph, and the infant Jesus.
meanings.sent1: During Christmas, many families display beautiful creches in their homes.
meanings.sent2: The intricate details of the creches make them a cherished holiday tradition.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the creches, creating a comical scene in the living room.
meanings.sent4: The glow of the candlelight cast a warm glow on the creches, bringing them to life.
meanings.sent5: The creches in the church were so lifelike, they seemed to transport you back in time.
